content.description: <math alttext="one neutron plus P u with mass number 239 and atomic number 94, react to produce X e with mass number 141 and atomic number 54, plus Z r with mass number 97 and atomic number 40, plus, blank, plus energy" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>n</mtext></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>Pu</mtext></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>94</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>239</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>Xe</mtext></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>54</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>141</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>Zr</mtext></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>97</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mtext>_____</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>energy</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: In the nuclear fission reaction represented above, what should be entered in the blank to create a balanced equation?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
